title: Cross Multiply
text: Cross multiply by taking the numerator of the first expression and multiplying it with the denominator of the second experssion. Then cross multiply the remaining numbers.
speech: Cross multiply by taking the numerator of the first expression and multiplying it with the denominator of the second experssion. Then cross multiply the remaining numbers.
pacedSpeech: Cross multiply by taking the numerator of the first expression and multiplying it with the denominator of the second experssion. Then cross multiply the remaining numbers.

title: Reformatting the Expression
text: Create a new expression by setting the first cross multiplication product with the second resulting in $$18q-36=4q-14$$
speech: Create a new expression by setting the first cross multiplication product with the second resulting in  18 q minus 36, is equal to, 4 q minus 14
pacedSpeech: Create a new expression by setting the first cross multiplication product with the second resulting in   18 q minus 36, is equal to, 4 q minus 14

title: Solving for the Variable
text: Isolate the variable and solve. What is the value of the variable?
speech: Isolate the variable and solve. What is the value of the variable?
